meanings.definition: To make theatrical; to adapt for the stage.
meanings.sent1: She theatricalized the play by adding colorful costumes and lively music.
meanings.sent2: The director theatricalized the classic novel, bringing it to life on stage.
meanings.sent3: The students theatricalized their history project with elaborate costumes and props.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling was so theatricalized that it felt like watching a live performance.
meanings.sent5: The magician theatricalized his tricks, mesmerizing the audience with his illusions.

meanings.definition: To give a dramatic or exaggerated quality to something.
meanings.sent1: The news report was theatricalized to grab viewers' attention.
meanings.sent2: She theatricalized her reaction to the surprise, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The cat theatricalized its hunger by meowing loudly at the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were so theatricalized that no one believed him anymore.
meanings.sent5: The storm theatricalized the night, with thunder and lightning illuminating the sky.
